channel.title: Tech on Kevin's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Kevin's Blog

item.title: React Native Learning
item.description: Create React App 1$ npm i -g create-react-native-app 2$ create-react-native-app my-project 3$ cd my-project 4$ npm start Run Android Emulator 1# List emulators 2emulator -list-avds 3# Run one of the emulator 4emulator -avd @name-of-your-emulator 5# Where emulator is under 6${ANDROID_SDK}/tools/emulator 1npm run android

item.title: Azure DevOps Web App CI/CD
item.description: React Web App Release: Startup command 1pm2 serve /home/site/wwwroot/ --no-daemon --spa References https://git-scm.com/docs/git-mv https://www.runoob.com/git/git-mv.html

item.title: Git Usage
item.description: Git File name changed, but git is not case sensitive It will not be detected by git when change the case of file names. Use git mv command to update the name, like this: 1git mv data.xml Data.xml Create .gitignore for existing project while the new ignored file was commited before. Steps to remove old commited file or directory from git: Create a new .gitignore file. Edit .gitignore to match the file/folder you want to ignore.

item.title: React Learning
item.description: Create React App Create React App 1npx create-react-app my-app 1cd my-app 2npm start # or 'yarn start' Modules Webpack: JavaScript bundler Babel: JavaScript complier ES Lint | extension: JavaScript linter Jest: JavaScript test framework Web Vitals: measuring performance, accessibility and best practice Project Structure 1-.github 2-node_modules 3-public: has files that Webpack will manage and will also be moved to server when publish 4-- index.html: the entry point for the browsers. Webpack use this file to inject JavaScript code you write as well as React code and other CSS.

item.title: CI/CD Command Line Tools
item.description: iOS xcodebuild archive and export ipa 1wsPath="./Failed/MyTestApp/MyTestApp.xcodeproj/project.xcworkspace" 2acPath="./Failed/MyTestApp/app.xcarchive" 3epPath="./Failed/MyTestApp/output/build/export/_XcodeTaskExport_MyTestApp" 4epoPlistPath="ExportOptions00.plist" 5unzipPayload="./Failed/MyTestApp/output/unzip/" 6 7rm -r $acPath 8rm -r $epPath 9rm -r $unzipPayload 10 11xcodebuild -workspace $wsPath -scheme MyTestApp clean CODE_SIGN_STYLE=Manual 12xcodebuild -workspace $wsPath -scheme MyTestApp archive -archivePath $acPath CODE_SIGN_STYLE=Manual 13xcodebuild -exportArchive -archivePath $acPath -exportPath $epPath -exportOptionsPlist $epoPlistPath 14 15unzip $epPath/MyTestApp.ipa -d $unzipPayload 16codesign -dv $unzipPayload/Payload/MyTestApp.app 17 18/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Print CFBundleVersion' [Info.plist] 19/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Print CFBundleIdentifier' [Info.plist] 20/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'Print' [Info.plist] 21 22https://medium.

item.title: JavaScript Learning
item.description: JavaScript Variables & Data Types var, let, const var: globally scope let: variable const: constant variable Always use const unless you know you will reassign the value, then use let. String, Numbers, Boolean, null, undefined 1const name = 'John' 2const age = 30; 3const isCool = true; 4const x = null; 5const y = undefined; 6let z; 7console.log(typeof name); String - Concatenation 1console.log('My name is ' + name + ' and I am ' + age); 2// Template String 3// Note: it's `` symbol not '' 4const hello = `My name is ${name} and I am ${age}`; 5console.

item.title: macOS App + Sparkle in App Center
item.description: macOS App Code Sign Apple Development Apple Distribution App Sandbox Sparkle (In-App Update) CocoPods: pod ‘Sparkle’ Set up a Sparkle updater object Set up SUFeedURL property in Info.plist Public Distribution Group (App Center) EdDSA (Edwards-curve Digital Signature Algorithm) Generate Public and Private Key (./bin/generate_keys) Set up SUPublicEDKey in Info.plist Generate EdDSA signature (./bin/sign_update) PATH signature to release (API) Validating Update Sandboxing and Sparkle 2.0 Sparkle 2.0 Integration Steps 1. Enable App Sandboxing if you need 2.
